717879f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - West Broadway.
717879f-a.text:
504-6 Broome Street, at and adjoini5g tle N.W.
corner of West Broadway, showing two old structures
that have remained,reminiscent of earlier days. The
Sixth Avenue ''El,'' shown on West Broadway, will shortly
be demolished (1939).
October 9, 1939
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
NO REPRODUECTIONS
717879f-a.folder: Broome Street & West Broadway., Manhattan, NY

724408f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Broome Street
724408f-a.text:
West Broadway, at,adjoining and south of the S.E.
corner of Broome Street. At the corner is a 35-story
atructure that bears No. 499 Broome Street. The 3-story
addition is No. 36) Wast Broadway. A seven story loft
structure forms an ''p' wtth an address at No. 495 Broome
Street. To the south of this are two low buildings (View 3);
No. 357 WeSt Broadway, being a former 2y-story residence.
May 19, 1939
Viows 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
724408f-a.folder: West Broadway & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

P. L. Sperr  July 2S, 1939

717877f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - West Broadway
717877f-a.text:
504 and 506 Broome Street, at and adjoining the N .W. corner
of West Broadway.
The loft structure partially seen at the left margin is
No. 508-1O.
July 2S, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
717877f-a.folder: Broome Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

717880f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - West Broadway
717880f-a.text:
(1)
5l4, 512, 510-508, 506, 504 Broome Street, north side, west of
adjoining, and at West Broadway, at the triangular plaza
where Watts Street joins Broome.
February 12, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, not including Nos. 506 and 504. The loft building
dates back around 1900. The frame-sided dormer windows,
on the two remaining old houses -- the ones at the corner
of Thompson Street were demolished aound 1923 -- would
lead one to guess they are of frame construction; but they
are brick.
1932 or 1933.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 559.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON AlLL REPRODUCTIONS.
717880f-a.folder: Broome Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724406f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Broome Street
724406f-b.text:
West Broadway, south from a point just north of Broome Street,
showing the Sixth Ave. Elevated line overshadowing this thoroughfare.
Aoross the roofs of buildings shown, appears the outline of the New
York Telephone Building.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same locale, subsecuent to 'El' demolition.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
N ~21(7.
